definition: to startle/to be frightened/to be scared/alarm

sentences.english: His denial that he had witnessed the accident dumbfounded me.
sentences.chinese: 他否認曾親眼目睹這一事故的發生把我驚呆了。

sentences.english: Zoo spokeswoman Durruty said everyone was "absolutely thrilled" at the sextuplets' birth.
sentences.chinese: 動物園女發言人杜魯蒂說大家都被六胞胎驚呆了。

sentences.english: The "girlfriend startled has stayed, is looking boyfriend's back, felt extremely despairs."
sentences.chinese: 女友驚呆了，望着男友的背影，感到非常絕望。

sentences.english: Second shot came when I was stupefied by the cannon's omnipotent, pervasive power.
sentences.chinese: 第二杆打在我的大炮的萬能的，普遍的權力驚呆了。

sentences.english: The janitor staggered down the stairway, stunned and gasping.
sentences.chinese: 瞧門人驚呆了，喘着粗氣，搖搖擺晃地走下樓梯。

sentences.english: "We were all stunned at how poor we were, " commented Brooking.
sentences.chinese: “我們都對我們拙劣的表現驚呆了，”布魯金評論到。

sentences.english: The astounded Lancelot asked what had happened.
sentences.chinese: 蘭斯洛特驚呆了，趕緊問發生了什麼事。

sentences.english: Vingo sat there stunned, looking at the oak tree.
sentences.chinese: 文戈坐在那裏望着橡樹驚呆了。
檢察官德魯羅賓遜驚呆了。

sentences.english: The three spectators seemed quite stupefied.
sentences.chinese: 三個旁觀者完全驚呆了。

sentences.english: The few mourners looked at her teenage street clothes with amazement.
sentences.chinese: 爲數不多的悼念者看她穿着十幾歲的街邊服裝驚呆了。

sentences.english: Zhang began checking real estate listings in his neighborhood a year and a half ago. He was stunned.
sentences.chinese: 一年半前小張開始關注周邊的房產價格，他驚呆了。

sentences.english: We were all astonished to see him force a bar hooking.
sentences.chinese: 看見他用手把一根鐵棒掰成鉤形，我們都驚呆了。

sentences.english: I was horrified. I never knew thatKing David would do such a thing.
sentences.chinese: 我被驚呆了，我從沒想過大衛王會答應這樣的事情。

sentences.english: At that moment, dad was shocked. He tried to say something but didn't.
sentences.chinese: 在那一刻爸驚呆了，他想要說些什麼，但最終沒有說。

sentences.english: What he saw in the starlight shocked him.
sentences.chinese: 藉着點點星光，他被自己所見的一幕驚呆了。

definition: to cry out in alarm or surprise
to exclaim in admiration/a gasp of surprise
to be startled/to be shocked/to be amazed
to be amazed/to be surprised/to wonder
to move emotionally/to stir up (emotions)/to excite
